page.title: 01OLDWAYS END AREA
page.content: This is a borderline area both for farming and situation. For the farmers it is still possible to keep dairy herds and there are still 4 milking units left. The remaining farmers, however, depend on beef and sheep. the area either side of the A361 is poorer land, especially to the south and the fields are only suitable for stock during the Summer. The north east section is not a Devonshire County Council responsibility, as this is the county border with Somerset The area is further crossed by the main power lines, which also pass through this borderline part of recliamed moorland.
